document.title: Kansas College and Career Ready Standards for History, Government, and Social Studies

7012CC69F2824877B78ACC0A15468B30.description: The student will use his/her understanding of these dynamic relationships to create a personal, community, state, and/or national narrative.

A27C8D27FEBD4CAD86E174B516CB2B3F.description: The student will investigate the relationship among people, places, ideas, and/or the environment and connect those relationships to contemporary issues.

286A27D13BD144AF8FFA0957F871157F.description: The student will analyze the context of significant relationships and draw conclusions about a contemporary world.

C01F3338618B47AC8646BDBBFE8A02C9.description: The student will recognize and evaluate dynamic relationships that impact lives in communities, states, and nations.

14144E4520934E9BB394C5F093E48032.description: Relationships among people, places, ideas, and environments are dynamic.

6CECF74D5C744217A72A13946D1764D3.description: The student will use his/her understanding of continuity and change to construct a model for contemporary reform.

465BAEDF6CBC4CC48A11A34AF24B2A5F.description: The student will investigate an example of continuity and/or change and connect that continuity and/or change to a contemporary issue.

83769653EA6949E8BADCCED9B4ABE3F2.description: The student will analyze the context of continuity and change and the vehicles of reform, drawing conclusions about past change and potential future change.

29F4FBFF867742428AED9E262EEA9223.description: The student will recognize and evaluate continuity and change over time and its impact on individuals, institutions, communities, states, and nations.

82D99AE957E44BE0A8E470B8025ECEBE.description: Societies experience continuity and change over time.

9ED9E76DF8FB4BA58B3E875B8530ECA6.description: The student will use his/her understanding of those beliefs, contributions, ideas, and diversity to justify or define how community, state, national, and international ideals shape contemporary society.

C58B7B4C58E143A582B51ED8B42ABBAA.description: The student will investigate specific beliefs, contributions, ideas, and/or diverse populations and connect those beliefs, contributions, ideas and/or diversity to contemporary issues.

EA5F06169D7E4F3E8016A4DD2D3BA051.description: The student will draw conclusions about significant beliefs, contributions, and ideas, analyzing the origins and context under which these competing ideals were reached and the multiple perspectives from which they come.

6C8F423563D94F989FB7F10EDE18407B.description: The student will recognize and evaluate significant beliefs, contributions, and ideas of the many diverse peoples and groups and their impact on individuals, communities, states, and nations.

4AB67EF260EA4697B9C876DBDB3E17A1.description: Societies are shaped by beliefs, ideas, and diversity.

228ED4D11EE54B0CAB88CD48B8BDEC98.description: The student will use his/her understanding of rights and responsibilities to address contemporary issues.

7C8261ED5BF749009EEDEF2DD9B56CFA.description: The student will investigate specific rights and responsibilities of individuals and connect those rights and responsibilities with contemporary issues.

DB0B2F3E514C45319847468BDD20D692.description: The student will analyze the context under which significant rights and responsibilities are defined and demonstrated, their various interpretations, and draw conclusions about those interpretations.

DBB64A742B414EE3B6F780730791A07B.description: The student will recognize and evaluate the rights and responsibilities of people living in societies.

898D16A835564F1F898401A5704F8061.description: The student will use his/her understanding of choices and consequences to construct a decision-making process and to justify a decision.

9E60CE93626A4A49A0118EEFADBE7FCF.description: The student will investigate examples of causes and consequences of particular choices and connect those choices with contemporary issues.

1E5A170CEE44409A907A930B66C13BA2.description: The student will analyze the context under which choices are made and draw conclusions about the motivations and goals of the decision-makers.

ADBA5155A48D4A43AA9116718B112016.description: The student will recognize and evaluate significant choices made by individuals, communities, states, and nations that have impacted our lives and futures.
